IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO FURTHER THE EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES OF UNION COUNTY COLLEGE
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE EXEMPT PURPOSE OF UNION COUNTY COLLEGE FOUNDATION (FOUNDATION) IS TO UNDERTAKE ACTIVITIES FOR THE GENERAL BENEFIT OF UNION COUNTY COLLEGE (COLLEGE), ITS STUDENTS, FACULTY, STAFF, FACILITIES AND PROGRAMS THAT WILL SUPPORT AND ADVANCE THE MISSION OF THE COLLEGE.THE FOUNDATION FOCUSES PARTICULARLY ON PROVIDING SCHOLARSHIPS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE TO QUALIFYING STUDENTS.
IRS990.Desc: SUPPORT COLLEGE: SCHOLARSHIPS AND OTHER AWARDS TO UNION COUNTY COLLEGE STUDENTS.

Form990PartVIISectionAGrp.TitleTxt: VOTING EX OFFICIO: ALUMNI ASSOC REP

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FOUNDATION MAINTAINS A COLLECTION OF PAINTINGS WHICH ARE ON DISPLAY THROUGHOUT THE UNION COUNTY COLLEGE CAMPUSES.
ENDOWMENT FUNDS ARE USED TO FURTHER THE MISSION OF THE ORGANIZATION BY EARNING INCOME TO PROVIDE SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS OF UNION COUNTY COLLEGE.

THE FOUNDATION REGULARLY REVIEWS AND EVALUATES ITS TAX POSITIONS TAKEN IN PREVIOUSLY FILED INFORMATION RETURNS AND AS REFLECTED IN ITS FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, WITH REGARD TO ISSUES AFFECTING ITS TAX-EXEMPT STATUS, UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME, AND RELATED MATTERS. THE FOUNDATION BELIEVES THAT IN THE EVENT OF AN EXAMINATION BY TAXING AUTHORITIES, THE ORGANIZATION'S POSITIONS WOULD PREVAIL BASED UPON THE TECHNICAL MERITS OF SUCH POSITIONS. THEREFORE, THE FOUNDATION HAS CONCLUDED THAT NO TAX BENEFITS OR LIABILITIES ARE REQUIRED TO BE RECOGNIZED IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE ACCOUNTING INTERPRETATION.
DIRECT SPECIAL EVENT EXPENSES 125,141. DIRECT GAMING EXPENSES 99.
DIRECT SPECIAL EVENT EXPENSES 125,141. DIRECT GAMING EXPENSES 99.

GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE TO INDIVIDUALS: THE FOUNDATION PROVIDES THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT OF UNION COUNTY COLLEGE WITH THE AMOUNTS FOR THE ENDOWED AND ANNUAL SCHOLARSHIPS. STUDENTS MUST COMPLETE AN ONLINE APPLICATION. FINANCIAL AID IDENTIFIES THE STUDENTS THAT MEET THE SPECIFIC QUALIFICATION(S). ONCE IDENTIFIED AND AWARDED, THE FOUNDATION REVIEWS THE LIST PROVIDED BY FINANCIAL AID TO CONFIRM THE FUNDS FOR EACH SCHOLARSHIP WERE PROPERLY APPLIED TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT.
THE FIGURE PRESENTS THE NUMBER OF ITEMS RECEIVED IN A GIVEN CATEGORY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 1A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: AN EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD SHALL BE ESTABLISHED ANNUALLY. ITS MEMBERSHIP SHALL BE NOT FEWER THAN FIVE (5) TRUSTEES AND SHALL INCLUDE THE CHAIR, THE VICE CHAIR, THE TREASURER, THE SECRETARY AND ONE OR MORE ADDITIONAL TRUSTEES. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE MAY RECOMMEND ACTIONS TO THE BOARD; AND THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE SHALL HAVE AND EXERCISE SUCH POWERS AND AUTHORITY OF THE BOARD AS THE BOARD MAY FROM TIME TO TIME BY RESOLUTION PROVIDE. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE DOES NOT HAVE THE AUTHORITY TO MAKE, ALTER, OR REPEAL ANY BYLAW OF THE FOUNDATION; ELECT OR APPOINT ANY TRUSTEE, OR REMOVE ANY TRUSTEE, OFFICER, OR THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR; OR, AMEND OR REPEAL ANY RESOLUTION PREVIOUSLY ADOPTED BY THE BOARD.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 3
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FOUNDATION PAYS UNION COUNTY COLLEGE (COLLEGE) FOR PROFESSIONAL SERVICES, WHICH INCLUDE MANAGEMENT SERVICES. MANAGEMENT SERVICES PROVIDED INCLUDE, BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO DEVELOPMENT ACTIVITIES. FOR THE YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2023, THE FOUNDATION PAID THE COLLEGE $198,376 FOR MANAGEMENT SERVICES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: AT LEAST ONE TRUSTEE IS REQUIRED TO ALSO BE A TRUSTEE OF THE COLLEGE, AND AT LEAST ONE TRUSTEE IS REQUIRED TO ALSO BE A GOVERNOR OF THE COLLEGE; THESE REQUIREMENTS MAY BE FILLED BY THE SAME TRUSTEE. IN ADDITION, THE INDIVIDUALS HOLDING THE FOLLOWING POSITIONS ARE AUTOMATICALLY CONSIDERED EX-OFFICIO VOTING TRUSTEE'S OF THE FOUNDATION: THE PRESIDENT OF THE COLLEGE, THE PRESIDENT OF THE UNION COUNTY COLLEGE ALUMNI ASSOCIATION, AND THE PRESIDENT OF THE UNION COUNTY COLLEGE STUDENT GOVERNMENT ASSOCIATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 IS PREPARED BY AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTING FIRM, THEN REVIEWED BY THE BOARD'S AUDIT COMMITTEE PRIOR TO SUBMISSION, AND THEN SUBMITTED TO EACH BOARD MEMBER. THE FULL BOARD APPROVES THE FORM 990. THE FORM 990 IS ALSO REVIEWED BY THE FOUNDATION'S LEGAL COUNSEL PRIOR TO ITS FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FOUNDATION TRUSTEES ARE REQUIRED TO COMPLETE/UPDATE CONFLICT OF INTEREST FORMS ANNUALLY. WHENEVER A CONFLICT OF INTEREST, POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST OR THE APPEARANCE OF A CONFLICT OF INTEREST ARISES, THE TRUSTEE, OFFICER OR EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR WITH THE CONFLICT (THE "INTERESTED PARTY") SHALL DISCLOSE IN GOOD FAITH THE MATERIAL FACTS AS OF SUCH SELF-INTEREST, FINANCIAL INTEREST OR APPEARANCE OF CONFLICT OF INTEREST TO THE TRUSTEES. ANY ACTION BY THE FOUNDATION TO APPROVE ACTIVITY IN WHICH A CONFLICT OF INTEREST, OR APPEARANCE OF CONFLICT EXISTS, SHALL BE APPROVED ONLY BY THE AFFIRMATIVE VOTE OF A MAJORITY OF DISINTERESTED TRUSTEES PRESENT AT A MEETING. THESE DISCLOSURE PROCEDURES SHOULD BE FOLLOWED WHENEVER THE FOUNDATION IS ENGAGED IN ANY TRANSACTION BETWEEN THE FOUNDATION AND AN INTERESTED PARTY OR A FAMILY MEMBER OF AN INTERESTED PARTY, OR BETWEEN THE FOUNDATION AND ANY OTHER CORPORATION, FIRM, OR BUSINESS INTEREST IN WHICH AN INTERESTED PARTY OR A FAMILY MEMBER OF AN INTERESTED PARTY HAS A SUBSTANTIAL FINANCIAL INTEREST.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST AT THE FOUNDATION'S OFFICE LOCATED AT 995 SPRINGFIELD AVENUE, CRANFORD, NJ 07016.
